channel.title: Pi error Rep++
channel.description:
I jarred and signed my client correctly, but whenever I try to run the jarred client, it says, Cannot find Main-Class: client. Program will exit..
How do I fix this? Rep++ if you can help

item.title: Pi error Rep++
item.dc:creator: @oxygen1 oxygen-_
item.description:
@oxygen1 wrote:

God dammit, go to google and type “Ric’s webclient tut” and its the first link…Skip down to “jarring and signing” and follow those instructions…If you still have the class error, delete every single class in your client, re compile, rejarr and resign(should be easy since you should have saved the settings for the jar" USE JAR MAKER! Not cmd…

rep++ if this helps

Read full topic

item.description:
@classic wrote:

Unicorn is hot bro.
If he fixed it topic should be locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Pi error Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Unicron Unicron
item.description:
@Unicron wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:20, topic:427023”]Are you sure you typed in the main class correctly, or even using the correct class to execute the program… For one Java is case sensitive, and two a lot of clients use either the GUI class or Client class, make sure when you set the manifest with jar maker that you type the class name the same was as it appears in the folder. So Client.class would be Client, not client as the jar wouldn’t be able to find it since you don’t intact have a client.class.

Also there’s no reason to switch to a different client, because any client with the manifest set correctly should run perfectly…[/quote]

[quote=“Unicron, post:19, topic:427023”][quote author=b00mz1029 link=topic=529724.msg3866682#msg3866682 date=1325044852]
God I’m sorry I’m confused, could somebody possibly teamview me and help (I’m hopeless)
[/quote]
fine, send me your information via pm

Edit: Problem solved at the moment, i figured he was editing the main class wrong but by looking at the signlink we uncovered that it was a 317 client (ofc being PI, a rip-off of the ‘Delta’ version servers and Galkon’s client). He was using the wrong material to make his webclient. So i found a tutorial more suited to his abilities and client and we are awaiting results.

Thank you.[/quote]
/thread
/win

Read full topic

item.title: Pi error Rep++
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Are you sure you typed in the main class correctly, or even using the correct class to execute the program… For one Java is case sensitive, and two a lot of clients use either the GUI class or Client class, make sure when you set the manifest with jar maker that you type the class name the same was as it appears in the folder. So Client.class would be Client, not client as the jar wouldn’t be able to find it since you don’t intact have a client.class.

Also there’s no reason to switch to a different client, because any client with the manifest set correctly should run perfectly…

Read full topic

He was using the wrong material to make his webclient. So i found a tutorial more suited to his abilities and client and we are awaiting results.

Thank you.

THIS is why i called him a dipshit.

en.wikipedia.org

Integrated development environment

An integrated development environment (IDE) is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development. An IDE normally consists of a source code editor, build automation tools, and a debugger. Most modern IDEs have intelligent code completion. Some IDEs, such as NetBeans and Eclipse, contain a compiler, interpreter, or both; others, such as SharpDevelop and Lazarus, do not. The boundary between an integrated development environment and other...


EDIT: sorry for coming off too rude, been fixing things since this morining, whole reason i came on this forum to begin with. -.-

item.title: Pi error Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Unicron Unicron
item.description:
@Unicron wrote:

This happens when you misplaced/mistyped a string in your program files (not the folder in your C:/, the actual files of your java program).
[quote="Pzezima2, post:5, topic:427023"][quote author=Unicron link=topic=529724.msg3866656#msg3866656 date=1325044266]
okay, then tell me. Why can you not simply program a file to run from the web via javascript. You have to rely on fuckin tutorials from a skiddie like yourself. Fuck off you bloody moron.
[/quote]

Unicron, just leave moparscape. 
I can't see you making any friends here or in real life.[/quote]
sure, as soon as you answer this man's question yourself, i cant wait to see you try and explain his error.

This happens when you misplaced/mistyped a string in your program files (not the folder in your C:/, the actual files of your java program).

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:5, topic:427023”][quote author=Unicron link=topic=529724.msg3866656#msg3866656 date=1325044266]

item.title: Pi error Rep++
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

Unicron:

You programed it wrong dipshit, obviously you need to edit it to where it recognizes the main class (client.java).

wat.

FYI: jar executables need a main class. if your jar can’t find the main class, then you didn’t do it right. did you jar it with an ide or by yourself? usually an ide will generate a manifest file, finding it for you. try again.

Read full topic
